title: How have the numbers of health visitors changed?
analysis_commentary:
Health visitors support and educate families from pregnancy through to a child's fifth birthday. Common tasks include: offering parenting support and advice on family health and minor illnesses, new birth visits which include advice on feeding, weaning and dental health, physical and developmental checks providing families with specific support on subjects such as postnatal depression.

The number of health visitors decreased from 8,100 in September 2009 to a low of 7,507 in August 2011 and increased to a peak of 10,308 in October 2016. In October 2010, the Government made a commitment to increase the numbers of health visiting staff aiming for an extra 4,200 health visitors by 2015. The number of health visiting staff (FTE) has increased from 8,092 in May 2010 to 11,331 in May 2015, but this has missed the target.

Updated November 2016
